blog_posts.title: How to Reduce Repeated IT Incidents in 30 Days
blog_posts.excerpt: A practical runbook-first process to reduce recurring support tickets and downtime.
blog_posts.content:
Start with incident categories and count repeats weekly. Then build one actionable runbook per top category.

Track response time, resolution time, and repeat rate. After two weeks, enforce change windows and backup checks.

blog_posts.title: Small Business Cloud Migration Checklist
blog_posts.excerpt: Key checks before, during, and after migration to avoid common outages.
blog_posts.content:
Document dependencies, define rollback, and test backups before moving production workloads.

After migration, validate monitoring, access policies, and spending alerts in the first 72 hours.

blog_posts.title: Backup Validation: What Most Teams Miss
blog_posts.excerpt: Backups are only useful if restore steps are tested and timed.
blog_posts.content:
Pick critical systems and perform scheduled restore drills. Record exact restore time and blockers.

Use findings to improve runbooks and set realistic recovery expectations with stakeholders.
